author: Universal Pictures
description:
Ambassador MacWhite (Marlon Brando) faces a congressional hearing, defending his stance with measured defiance as political tensions over Southeast Asia mount.

Synopsis:
An American ambassador arrives in a fictional Southeast Asian country on the brink of communist revolution, forced to face the true consequences of diplomacy, arrogance, and power.

© Universal Pictures (1963)
Cast: Marlon Brando, Sandra Church, Eiji Okada, Pat Hingle, Arthur Hill, Jocelyn Brando, Kukrit Pramoj
Director: George Englund
Producers: George Englund
Screenwriters: Stewart Stern (screenplay), based on the novel by Eugene Burdick and William J. Lederer
title: The Ugly American | Ambassador MacWhite's Congressional Hearing (Marlon Brando)
